IP2025037_syn_1:
Indication: Tracheal stenosis (post-intubation).
Proc: Rigid bronch, Balloon dilation, Silicone Stent.
Details: 70% subglottic stenosis. Dilated to 12mm. 12x40mm Dumon stent placed. Residual 10% narrowing.
Plan: Admit overnight.
IP2025037_syn_2:
PROCEDURE: Therapeutic Rigid Bronchoscopy for Tracheal Stenosis.
INDICATION: Exertional stridor, benign tracheal stenosis.
NARRATIVE: Rigid bronchoscopy id[REDACTED] a concentric fibrotic stenosis in the subglottic trachea. The lesion was dilated serially with balloons. A 12x40mm silicone stent was deployed to maintain patency. The airway caliber significantly improved.
IMPRESSION: Successful recanalization and stenting of benign tracheal stenosis.
IP2025037_syn_3:
Code: 31631 (Tracheal Stent Placement).
Note: Dilation (31630) is bundled/included when stent is placed.
Device: Silicone Stent.
Indication: Benign stenosis.
IP2025037_syn_4:
Procedure: Rigid Bronch & Stent
Patient: [REDACTED]
Steps:
1. GA / Jet ventilation.
2. Rigid scope 11.
3. Found tight stenosis in trachea.
4. Balloon dilated.
5. Placed silicone stent.
6. Airway looks good now.
Plan: Observe overnight.
IP2025037_syn_5: [REDACTED] 58 male with stridor. Tracheal stenosis from old intubation. Did rigid bronch under jet vent. dilated it up with a balloon then put a silicone stent 12 by 40. looks wide open now. minor bleeding. admit for obs.
IP2025037_syn_6: Central Airway Therapeutic Bronchoscopy Note. Procedures: Rigid bronchoscopy, Balloon dilation of tracheal stenosis, Silicone stent placement. Patient: [REDACTED]. Findings: Short-segment concentric fibrotic stenosis 2 cm below vocal cords; ~70% luminal narrowing. Intervention: Serial balloon dilations performed to 12 mm, then a 12 x 40 mm silicone straight stent placed across the stenotic segment. Disposition: Extubated to PACU and admitted overnight.
IP2025037_syn_7:
[Indication]
Post-intubation tracheal stenosis.
[Anesthesia]
General, Rigid, Jet Vent.
[Description]
Subglottic stenosis dilated (balloon). 12x40mm silicone stent placed. Patency restored.
[Plan]
Admit. Airway monitoring.
IP2025037_syn_8: [REDACTED] from stridor due to scar tissue in his trachea from a breathing tube. We took him to the OR and used a rigid scope to dilate the scar tissue with a balloon. To keep it open, we placed a silicone stent. His airway is much more open now, and he should breathe easier. We'll watch him overnight.
IP2025037_syn_9:
Procedure: Rigid airway dilation and prosthetic scaffolding.
Indication: Cicatricial tracheal stenosis.
Action: The stenotic segment was radially expanded via balloon. A silicone prosthesis was deployed to prevent recoil.
Result: Restoration of tracheal lumen.
IP2025037:
Central Airway Therapeutic Bronchoscopy Note
Procedures:
1. Rigid bronchoscopy
2. Balloon dilation of tracheal stenosis
3. Silicone stent placement
Patient: [REDACTED], 58-year-old male with prior prolonged intubation now with fixed upper airway obstruction and exertional stridor.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with rigid bronchoscope size 11 and jet ventilation.
Findings: Short-segment concentric fibrotic stenosis 2 cm below vocal cords; ~70% luminal narrowing.
Intervention: Serial balloon dilations performed to 12 mm, then a 12 x 40 mm silicone straight stent placed across the stenotic segment. Postprocedure lumen patency ~10% residual narrowing.
Complications: Minor mucosal bleeding controlled with epinephrine.
Disposition: Extubated to PACU on 4 L nasal cannula and admitted overnight for airway monitoring.
